Iglesias-Martinez and Walter Kolch and Vadim Zhernovkov},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0, https://sidex71.github.io/ULM/},   url = {https://github.com/Sidex71/ULM}, }

what: Inferring Physical Cell-cell Interaction Networks from ScRNAseq Data
title: Inferring Physical Cell-cell Interaction Networks from ScRNAseq Data
text: R package prediction identification multiplets scRNAseq datasets infer physical cell-cell interaction networks. Multiplets occur naturally conventional scRNAseq due incomplete dissociation library preparation. represent cells physically connected interacting tissues become sequenced together remain unseperated. ULM utilizes signature-based approach univariate linear models fitted barcode scRNAseq data assign signature scores. Barcodes classified singlets multiplets based signature scores. Multiplets barcodes cells enriched two cell type-specific gene signatures.

title: Inferring Physical Cell-cell Interaction Networks from ScRNAseq Data
text: can install development version ULM GitHub : full guide usage ULM can found package vignettes full tutorials
code: if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("devtools") } library(devtools)  devtools::install_github("Sidex71/ULM")

title: Inferring Physical Cell-cell Interaction Networks from ScRNAseq Data
text: package depends Seurat (>= 3.0.0), decoupleR, tidyverse, dplyr, stringr, igraph, ggraph, tidygraph, ggplot2, magrittr, tibble. required packages might automatically installed alongside ULM package already installed.

title: Inferring Physical Cell-cell Interaction Networks from ScRNAseq Data
text: quick example shows infer physical cell-cell interaction network scRNAseq data:  comprehensive guide usage ULM package can found full tutorials
code: library(ULM) #####load dataset data("int_singData")  ##int_singData is a preprocessed scRNAseq seurat object with a Cell_Type column containing cell annotations. ##generate signatures set.seed(101324) int_sig <- ULM::GetSignature(int_singData, ident_col = int_singData$Cell_Type, n = 100) #> using the specified seurat ident to generate signatures #> Calculating cluster Progenitor early #> Warning: The `slot` argument of `GetAssayData()` is deprecated as of SeuratObject 5.0.0. #> ℹ Please use the `layer` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the Seurat package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/satijalab/seurat/issues>. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. #> Warning: `PackageCheck()` was deprecated in SeuratObject 5.0.0. #> ℹ Please use `rlang::check_installed()` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the Seurat package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/satijalab/seurat/issues>. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. #> Calculating cluster Progenitor late-1 #> Calculating cluster Transit amplifying #> Calculating cluster Progenitor late-2 #> Calculating cluster Goblet #> Calculating cluster Stem #> Calculating cluster Enterocyte #> Calculating cluster Paneth #> Calculating cluster Enteroendocrine #> Calculating cluster Tuft  ###score cells and assign labels my_scores <- GetCellScores(seurat_obj = int_singData, signatures = int_sig, assay = 'RNA', layer  = 'data') my_assign <- GetCellAssignments(score_data = my_scores, cut_off = 1, p_val = 0.05) int_singData <- AddMetaObject(int_singData, cell_class_df = my_assign)  #####filter multiplets my_mult_filt <- FilterMultiplet(int_singData, minCells = 2, minFreq = 10) #> Warning: Removing 1929 cells missing data for vars requested multSummaryFilt <- my_mult_filt$multSummaryFilt  ###plot network my_node_df <- GetNodeDF(mat = multSummaryFilt) PlotNetwork(my_node_df) #########################################################################################

what: Full Tutorials- A complete guide on the ULM Package
title: Inferring Physical Cell-cell Interaction Networks from ScRNAseq Data
text: Introduction ULM package reconstruct physical cell-cell interaction networks conventional scRNAseq datasets using signature-based approach. Basically, ULM utilises univariate linear models identify multiplets (mostly doublets) potentially represent undissociated cell fractions physically connected cell neighbors tissue. first load ULM package vignette, first test ULM scRNAseq dataset small intestinal tissue (Andrews et al., 2021, pubmed: GSE175664). preprocessed scRNAseq can loaded running code: Let us visualise metadata see available cell annotations can see, ‘Cell_Type’ column contains cell annotations. Let us visualize annotated Seurat clusters  Now let us use ULM pipeline identify multiplets present data infer physical interaction network. first step pipeline generate cell type-specific gene signatures. generate default 100 genes best mark annotated cell type cluster data. Let us visualize signature table looks like signature table 3 columns, source column contains cell type, target column contains genes mor column contains weights. Next, score cell scRNseq data cell signatures fitting univariate linear models. score signatures barcode (cell) normalised gene count matrix, found layer = ‘data’ (slot = ‘data’, older Seurat versions). use raw count, set layer = ‘count’ (slot = ‘count’, older Seurat versions). NB: Seurat object older Seurat versions, layers absent, case please set layer = NULL, slot = ‘data’. Let us visualize cell score data frame seen, cell score data frame contains scores barcodes cell signature well p values. Positive scores infer enriched signatures negative scores infer non-enriched signatures barcode. Next label barcode cell types based signature scores. Cells one significant signature score single-cell label cells one significant signature score multi-cell label. Please note barcodes cells used interchangeably. choose cut-1 depict enriched signatures. means considered negative scores 1 non-enriched. Ideally, positive scores considered enriched choosing cut-1 increase precision cell assignment. However, users may choose set cut-0 higher. Note trade cutoff cell dropout. Let us visualize cell assignment data frame. can see, cell assignment data frame dedicated column called “count_ulm” tells many cell signatures given barcode . example, count_ulm value 2 means barcode significant score two different signatures predicted doublet, value 3 represents predicted triplet. Also, “celltype_ulm” column contains specific signatures barcode expresses. example, first 3 barcodes count_ulm values 2 associated cell labels “Enterocyte_Progenitor late-1” seen celltype_ulm column. means barcodes cells (doublets) enriched dual gene signatures. Now predicted barcode data assigned labels based cell type-specific gene sigatures, can add new labels associated statistics metadata Seurat Object. Let us view metadata add predicted labels Now let us add predicted labels view metadata. Obviously, statistics, count_ulm, celltype_ulm, avg_pvalue avg_score columns now added Seurat Object. count_ulm celltype_ulm columns explained previous section. avg_score contains average predicted scores signatures enriched barcode, avg_pvalue takes average p values associated scores. Since p value statistically significant, taking average ensure final p value remains statistically significant. average scores p values applicable multiplets (count_ulm > 2) multi signature scores, singlets (count_ulm = 1) retain single scores p values. Finally, barcodes NAs newly added column, represent barcodes significantly enrich signature. final steps pipeline involve isolating multiplets plotting physical cell-cell interaction network. Let us isolate multiplets Seurat Object, setting minCells = 2, meaning want barcodes doublets . Set minCells 3 want triplets etc. generates list containing multiplet Seurat Object multiplet. multiplet summary shows multiplet types frequency. Let us show multiplet summary table. can also see total number predicted multiplets summary table multiplet Seurat Object just typical object can utilised multiplet modeling downstream analysis user pleases. Let us see multiplet Seurat Object. can also see multiplet order multiplet object 698 multiplets total, , 673 doublets 25 triplets. can observe multiplet summary table, multiplet types (e.g Enterocyte_Paneth_Progenitor.late.1) frequency 1, meaning one cell (barcode) belong multiplet type, occuring dataset. However, multiplet types frequency well 100, meaning types found well 100 barcodes. improve confidence, imperative filter obtained multiplets discard found sufficient number barcodes. Now let us filter multiplets include muliplet types found least 10 barcodes (minFreq = 10). Similarly, returns list filtered multiplet summary table filtered multiplet Seurat Object. filtered table now contain multiplet types frequency 10 . Also multiplet types now reduced 28 6 filtering. can similarly explore filtered multiplet object. , can used downstream analysis typical scRNAseq data user pleases. Finally, plot cell-cell interaction network filtered multiplets. , need first decompose filtered multiplet summary table pairwise node-edge data frame. Let us view pairwise node-edge dataframeformed Finally, can plot physical interaction network  Indeed, see interactions involving progenitors intestinal epithelial cells. biologically plausible since progenitor cells known transition stages replace rapidly old intestinal epithelial cells enterocyte, transit amplifying cells goblet cells. final part vignette, show also possible use reference scRNAseq data set generate signatures can utilised predict multiplet depict physical interactions different query scRNAseq data similar tissue origin. purpose, use intestinal scRNAseq data reference generate signatures. utilise predict multiplets query dataset partially dissociated intestinal scRNAseq data study (Andrews et al., 2021, pubmed: GSE175664). load query reference data sets Let us generate signatures reference dataset NB: also possible directly import utilize reference signature must formatted suit output GetSignature() function . , must data frame (tibble) 3 columns- source, target mor, containing cell type, signatures weight (=1) respectively. utilize reference signature predict multiplets query data set construct physical cell-cell interaction network. Getting query cell scores Assigning cell labels Adding cell labels metadata Obtaining predicted multiplets Multiplet summary table Multiplet order Filtering multiplets Filtered multiplet summary table Generating pairwise node-edge data frame filtered multiplet summary table Plotting query cell-cell interaction network  END Reference Andrews N, Serviss JT, Geyer N, Andersson AB, Dzwonkowska E, Šutevski , et al. unsupervised method physical cell interaction profiling complex tissues. Nat Methods. 2021;18:912–20.

Progenitor early_Progenitor late-1         6 #> 29                    Progenitor early_Progenitor late-2         1 #> 30                   Progenitor early_Transit amplifying        79 #> 31 query_multObj <- query_mult$multObj query_multObj #> An object of class Seurat  #> 15615 features across 999 samples within 1 assay  #> Active assay: RNA (15615 features, 2000 variable features) #>  3 layers present: counts, data, scale.data #>  2 dimensional reductions calculated: pca, umap table(query_multObj$count_ulm) #>  #>   2   3   4  #> 904  93   2 query_mult_filt <- FilterMultiplet(lab_query_obj, minFreq = 7) #> Warning: Removing 830 cells missing data for vars requested query_multSummaryFilt <- query_mult_filt$multSummaryFilt query_multSummaryFilt #> main_size = 25)

what: adding cell assignments to seurat object — AddMetaObject
title: adding cell assignments to seurat object — AddMetaObject
text: 'AddMtaObject()' function add predicted cell labels metadata scRNAseq

title: adding cell assignments to seurat object — AddMetaObject
code: AddMetaObject(seurat_obj, cell_class_df)

title: adding cell assignments to seurat object — AddMetaObject
text: seurat_obj prepossessed Seurat object storing scRNAseq data cell_class_df data frame cell barcodes cell type assignments, ideally obtained output GetCellAssignments() function.

title: adding cell assignments to seurat object — AddMetaObject
text: new Seurat object updated metadata containing predicted cell labels "celltype_ulm" column

title: adding cell assignments to seurat object — AddMetaObject
code: data(int_multData) data(int_signature) my_scores <- GetCellScores(seurat_obj = int_multData[,1:1000], signatures = int_signature, assay = 'RNA', layer = 'data') my_ass <- GetCellAssignments(score_data = my_scores) new_obj <- AddMetaObject(seurat_obj = int_multData[,1:1000], cell_class_df = my_ass) head(new_obj$celltype_ulm, 20) #>                      AAACCCACAAATCGTC                      AAACCCACACAACGCC  #>                    "Progenitor.early"                   "Progenitor.late.2"  #>                      AAACCCAGTATCTCGA                      AAACCCAGTCATGCAT  #>                              "Goblet"                              "Goblet"  #>                      AAACGAAAGGTAGTCG                      AAACGAACACCAACAT  #>                              "Goblet"                       "Goblet_Paneth"  #>                      AAACGAAGTATCGAAA                      AAACGAATCCGTAGGC  #>                                    NA        "Enterocyte_Progenitor.late.1"  #>                      AAACGCTCAACGGGTA                      AAACGCTCAGCCTACG  #>        "Enterocyte_Progenitor.late.1" "Progenitor.early_Transit.amplifying"  #>                      AAACGCTGTATGAGAT                      AAACGCTTCATGGAGG  #>                    "Progenitor.early"                              "Goblet"  #>                      AAACGCTTCTTCTAAC                      AAAGAACAGACATCAA  #>                                "Tuft"                              "Goblet"  #>                      AAAGAACAGGCTTCCG                      AAAGAACCAGAGACTG  #> "Progenitor.late.1_Progenitor.late.2"                              "Goblet"  #>                      AAAGAACCAGCAGAAC                      AAAGAACCAGCGACCT  #>                                    NA                              "Goblet"  #>                      AAAGAACGTCCACAGC                      AAAGGATGTCATCAGT  #>                   "Progenitor.late.1"                              "Goblet"

title: filtering multiplets — FilterMultiplet
text: 'FilterMultiplet()' function filter multiplets predefined frequency

title: filtering multiplets — FilterMultiplet
code: FilterMultiplet(seurat_obj, minCells = 2, minFreq = 10)

title: filtering multiplets — FilterMultiplet
text: seurat_obj Seurat object metadata containing predicted cell labels "celltype_ulm" column number cells "count_ulm" column. Ideally output AddMetObject() function multiplet Seurat object GetMultiplet() function minCells numeric value specifying minimum number cells. Default 2 include doublets /higher order multiplets minFreq numeric value specifying minimum frequency multiplet type retained. Default 10.

title: filtering multiplets — FilterMultiplet
text: filtered list containing Seurat object multiplets dataframe multiplet distribution summary.

title: filtering multiplets — FilterMultiplet
code: data(int_multData) data(int_signature) my_scores <- GetCellScores(seurat_obj = int_multData[,1:1000], signatures = int_signature, assay = 'RNA', layer = 'data') my_ass <- GetCellAssignments(score_data = my_scores) new_obj <- AddMetaObject(seurat_obj = int_multData[,1:1000], cell_class_df = my_ass) my_mult <- GetMultiplet(seurat_obj = new_obj) #> Warning: Removing 223 cells missing data for vars requested my_mult_filt <- FilterMultiplet(seurat_obj = new_obj) #> Warning: Removing 223 cells missing data for vars requested my_mult_filt #> $multSummaryFilt #>                                     multipletType frequency #> 3                    Enterocyte_Progenitor.late.1        69 #> 4  Enterocyte_Progenitor.late.1_Progenitor.late.2        15 #> 7                                   Goblet_Paneth        56 #> 8                         Goblet_Progenitor.early        24 #> 20            Progenitor.early_Transit.amplifying        21 #> 21            Progenitor.late.1_Progenitor.late.2        57 #>  #> $multObjFilt #> An object of class Seurat  #> 15615 features across 242 samples within 1 assay  #> Active assay: RNA (15615 features, 2000 variable features) #>  3 layers present: counts, data, scale.data #>  2 dimensional reductions calculated: pca, umap #>

title: getting final cell assignments — GetCellAssignments
text: 'GetCellAssignments()' function assigns cell type labels barcode based signature scores

title: getting final cell assignments — GetCellAssignments
code: GetCellAssignments(score_data, p_val = 0.05, cut_off = 1)

title: getting final cell assignments — GetCellAssignments
text: score_data data frame cell barcodes gene signature scores, ideally obtained output GetCellScores() function. p_val numeric value specifying p value cut-filter significant signature scores (default: 0.05) cut_off numeric value specifying cut-signature scores (default: 1)

title: getting final cell assignments — GetCellAssignments
text: data frame cell barcodes cell type assignments. barcode may assigned single multi cell type assignment depending signature enrichment scores.

title: getting final cell assignments — GetCellAssignments
code: data(int_singData) data(int_signature) my_scores <- GetCellScores(seurat_obj = int_singData[,1:1000], signatures = int_signature, assay = 'RNA', layer = 'data') my_ass <- GetCellAssignments(score_data = my_scores) head(my_ass) #>            barcode statistic count_ulm                        celltype_ulm #> 1 AAAGGTATCGGCTTCT       ulm         2        Enterocyte_Progenitor.late.1 #> 2 AACAGGGAGAAGTCAT       ulm         2        Enterocyte_Progenitor.late.1 #> 3 AACCAACCATCAGCAT       ulm         2        Enterocyte_Progenitor.late.1 #> 4 AACCTGAGTACCGTCG       ulm         3 Enterocyte_Paneth_Progenitor.late.1 #> 5 AACGAAACAAGCGCAA       ulm         2        Enterocyte_Progenitor.late.1 #> 6 AACGAAACAGGTCCCA       ulm         2        Enterocyte_Progenitor.late.1 #>     avg_pvalue avg_score #> 1 2.523098e-13  8.319202 #> 2 2.424298e-15  8.761571 #> 3 9.232242e-16  8.127915 #> 4 8.578408e-06  7.990285 #> 5 2.859176e-09  5.994553 #> 6 1.859488e-17  8.907267

what: scoring cells for gene signatures — GetCellScores
title: scoring cells for gene signatures — GetCellScores
text: 'GetCellScores()' scores cell scRNAseq data cell type-specific gene signatures

title: scoring cells for gene signatures — GetCellScores
code: GetCellScores(   seurat_obj,   signatures,   assay = "RNA",   slot = NULL,   layer = "data" )

title: scoring cells for gene signatures — GetCellScores
text: seurat_obj preprocessed Seurat object storing scRNAseq data signatures data frame cell type signatures cell types source column, genes target column, weights mor column. Ideally output GetSignature() function. assay character specifying assay Seurat object containing count matrix. layer character specifying layer draw counts (Seurat v3/v4). can "counts" raw counts, "data" normalized counts, "scaled" scaled counts. Default NULL.

title: scoring cells for gene signatures — GetCellScores
text: data frame cell barcodes gene signature scores

title: scoring cells for gene signatures — GetCellScores
code: data(int_singData) data(int_signature) my_scores <- GetCellScores(seurat_obj = int_singData[,1:1000],                            signatures = int_signature,                            assay = 'RNA',                            layer = 'data') head(my_scores) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   barcode          celltype   score   p_value statistic #>   <chr>            <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>     #> 1 AAACGAAAGAGGTCGT Enterocyte -3.20 0.00136   ulm       #> 2 AAACGAAAGCCTCCAG Enterocyte -3.30 0.000974  ulm       #> 3 AAACGAAAGTTTGGCT Enterocyte -3.88 0.000106  ulm       #> 4 AAACGAACACAAGCTT Enterocyte -4.31 0.0000164 ulm       #> 5 AAACGAAGTCGCTTGG Enterocyte -1.22 0.221     ulm       #> 6 AAACGAAGTCTTACTT Enterocyte -4.01 0.0000622 ulm

title: getting nodes and edges — GetNodeDF
text: 'GetNodeDF()' function generate nodes edges multiplet data

title: getting nodes and edges — GetNodeDF
code: GetNodeDF(mat)

title: getting nodes and edges — GetNodeDF
text: mat data frame multiplets types frequencies, ideally summary data frame obtained FilterMultiplet() GetMultiplet() function.

title: getting nodes and edges — GetNodeDF
text: data frame cell-cell edges nodes corresponding frequencies

title: getting nodes and edges — GetNodeDF
code: mat <- data.frame('multilpetType' = c(paste('A', 'B', 'C', sep = '_'),                                       paste('A', 'B', sep = '_'),                                       paste('B', 'C', 'A', 'E', sep = '_'),                                       paste('D', 'C', 'E', sep = '_')),                   frequency = rep(50, 4))  mat #>   multilpetType frequency #> 1         A_B_C        50 #> 2           A_B        50 #> 3       B_C_A_E        50 #> 4         D_C_E        50 GetNodeDF(mat) #>    Cell1 Cell2 n_cells #> 1      B     A      50 #> 2      C     A      50 #> 3      A     B     100 #> 4      A     C      50 #> 5      B     C     100 #> 6      D     C      50 #> 7      A     E      50 #> 8      B     E      50 #> 9      C     E     100 #> 10     D     E      50

title: generating gene signature — GetSignature
text: 'GetSignature()' generates cell type-specific gene signatures scRNAseq data

title: generating gene signature — GetSignature
code: GetSignature(seurat_obj, ident_col = NULL, n = 100, p_val = 0.05)

title: generating gene signature — GetSignature
text: seurat_obj prepossessed Seurat object storing scRNAseq data ident_col column Seurat object metadata character vector storing cell names labels. specified, default ident Seurat object used. n numeric value specifying number genes used cell signature. Default 100 genes per cell type. p_val numeric value specifying adjusted p-value cut-

title: generating gene signature — GetSignature
text: dataframe cell type signatures.

title: generating gene signature — GetSignature
code: data(int_singData) int_sig <- GetSignature(seurat_obj = int_singData[,1:1000], ident_col = int_singData$Cell_Type) #> using the specified seurat ident to generate signatures #> Calculating cluster Progenitor early #> Warning: The `slot` argument of `GetAssayData()` is deprecated as of SeuratObject 5.0.0. #> ℹ Please use the `layer` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the Seurat package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/satijalab/seurat/issues>. #> Warning: `PackageCheck()` was deprecated in SeuratObject 5.0.0. #> ℹ Please use `rlang::check_installed()` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the Seurat package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/satijalab/seurat/issues>. #> Calculating cluster Progenitor late-1 #> Calculating cluster Transit amplifying #> Calculating cluster Progenitor late-2 #> Calculating cluster Goblet #> Calculating cluster Stem #> Calculating cluster Enterocyte #> Calculating cluster Paneth #> Calculating cluster Enteroendocrine #> Calculating cluster Tuft head(int_sig) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #> # Groups:   source [1] #>   source           target          mor #>   <chr>            <chr>         <dbl> #> 1 Progenitor early C330021F23Rik     1 #> 2 Progenitor early Cdc25c            1 #> 3 Progenitor early Knstrn            1 #> 4 Progenitor early Ccnb2             1 #> 5 Progenitor early Cdkn3             1 #> 6 Progenitor early Cenpa             1

title: plotting network — PlotNetwork
text: 'PlotNetwork()' function plot customizable cell-cell interaction network graph

title: plotting network — PlotNetwork
code: PlotNetwork(   network_df,   node_size = 20,   node_color = "blue",   node_text_size = 4,   edge_width_factor = 50,   edge_color = "red",   network_layout = "fr",   legend_title = "Scaled Counts",   legend_position = "bottom",   min_edge_width = 0.5,   max_edge_width = 3,   main = "Network Plot",   main_size = 15,   hjust = 0.5,   legend_text_size = 12,   legend_title_size = 14 )

title: plotting network — PlotNetwork
text: network_df data frame containing network data, ideally output GetNodeDF() function containing edges, nodes weights. node_size numeric value specifying size nodes plot (default: 20). node_color character defining color nodes (default: "blue"). node_text_size numeric value specifying size text labels nodes (default: 4). edge_width_factor numeric value specifying scaling factor applied edge weights determine edge width (default: 50). edge_color character specifying color edges (default: "red"). network_layout character defining layout algorithm use positioning nodes (default: "fr"). Common options include `"fr"` (Fruchterman–Reingold), `"kk"` (Kamada–Kawai), Large Graph Layout `"lgl"` legend_title character specifying title legend (default: "Scaled Counts"). legend_position character specifying position plot legend (default: "bottom"). Options include `"bottom"`, `"top"`, `"left"`, `"right"` . min_edge_width numeric value defining minimum width edges (default: 0.5). max_edge_width numeric value defining maximum width edges (default: 3). main character specifying main title plot (default: "Network Plot"). main_size numeric value specifying text size main plot title (default: 15). hjust numeric value defining horizontal justification main title (default: 0.5, centered). legend_text_size numeric value specifying text size legend (default: 12). legend_title_size numeric value specifying size legend title (default: 14).

title: plotting network — PlotNetwork
text: `ggplot`  `ggraph` object representing cell-cell interaction network visualization.

title: plotting network — PlotNetwork
code: my_network_df <- data.frame(Cell1 =c('A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E', 'F'),                             Cell2= c('D', 'A', 'F', 'C', 'F', 'B'),                             n_cells = c(20, 40, 60, 80, 100, 120))  PlotNetwork(network_df = my_network_df)
